page.title: 20RELIGION
page.content: There are 5 old parish churches, 2 of which are now in Oxford and 3 in surrounding villages. The church of St. Mary the Virgin in Iffley was built 900 years ago. Its splendid Norman architecture attracts many visitors from all over the world. There are also Norman features at the Church of St. Andrew, in Sandford, which was founded in ll00. The church of St. James in Cowley dates from the early eighteenth century. St. Mary and St. Nicholas' Church at Littlemore was founded by John Henry Newman in l836. Today it stands as a living memorial to the Oxford Movement: the focus of worship is the l0.00 a.m. Parish Mass. There are two churches on the same site in Kennington dedicated to St. Swithun. A Norman church which is no longer used has a modern church beside it.
